text: Gino Severini (7 April 1883 â€“ 26 February 1966), was an Italian painter. He was a founding member of the Futurist movement. As a young man, he was introduced to Impressionism. This is a type of painting that was popular in the late 1800s. In the early 1900s, he became interested in Cubism. In the 1920s, he started to paint more traditionally and painted a few murals in Switzerland. In the 1940s, he started painting more abstractly again. He died in 1966 in Paris. ==Related pages== * List of Italian painters category:Italian painters Category:1883 births Category:1966 deaths
title: Gino Severini
